title: How to Calibrate a Digital Multimeter Using a 5.000 V DC Reference
steps: Allow DMM and voltage reference to warm up for 30 minutes in a ±0.5°C room.
Set DMM to DC voltage mode with 0.1 mV resolution.
Connect reference to DMM using shielded cables; minimize lead loop area.
Wait 10 seconds for reading to stabilize.
If DMM reads ±0.001 V from 5.000 V, note the offset.
If internal adjustment is possible, calibrate zero point and span using trimpots or service menu according to manufacturer specs.
Recheck: reading should now be within ±0.0005 V of 5.000 V (±0.01%).
